com.googlecode.gwtphonegap.client.compass
Interface Compass

All Known Subinterfaces:
CompassMock
All Known Implementing Classes:
CompassBrowserImpl, CompassJsImpl
public interface Compass

Obtains the direction that the device is pointing.

Author:
Daniel Kurka

Method Summary

Method Detail

getCurrentHeading

void getCurrentHeading(CompassOptions options,
                       CompassCallback callback)
Get the current compass heading. The compass is a sensor that detects the direction or heading that the device is pointed. It measures the heading in degrees from 0 to 359.99. The compass heading is returned using the CompassCallback

Supported Platforms

  • Android
  • iPhone

Parameters:
options - the options when capturing data
callback - the callback to invoke when data is ready or operation has failed

watchHeading

CompassWatcher watchHeading(CompassOptions options,
                            CompassCallback callback)
At a regular interval, get the compass heading in degrees. The compass is a sensor that detects the direction or heading that the device is pointed. It measures the heading in degrees from 0 to 359.99. The compass.watchHeading gets the device's current heading at a regular interval. Each time the heading is retrieved, the headingSuccess callback function is executed. Specify the interval in milliseconds via the frequency parameter in the compassOptions object. The returned watch ID references references the compass watch interval. The watch ID can be used with compass.clearWatch to stop watching the compass.

Supported Platforms

  • Android
  • iPhone

Parameters:
options - the options when capturing data
callback - the callback to invoke when data is ready or operation has failed
Returns:
reference to clear the watcher

clearWatcher

void clearWatcher(CompassWatcher watcher)
Stop watching the compass referenced by the watch ID parameter.

Parameters:
watcher - the watcher from watchHeading(CompassOptions, CompassCallback)
